page.title: 15ECOLOGY OF EAST MONKLANDS 3
page.content: MONKLANDS DISTRICT COUNCIL FULLY RECOGNISES THE VALUE OF TREES AND FORESTRY AS A MEANS OF OVERCOMING ENVIRONMENTAL BLIGHT. HOWEVER, FINANCE IS LIMITED AND THE MAIN HELP IN TREE PLANTING PROJECTS COMES FROM THE {CENTRAL SCOTLAND WOODLANDS {PROJECT.} THIS WAS SET UP IN 1979 BY THE COUNTRYSIDE COMMISSION FOR SCOTLAND AND COVERS A NO-MAN'S LAND IN THE EDGE OF CENTRAL, LOTHIAN AND STRATHCLYDE REGIONS, AN AREA OF BLEAK, WINDSWEPT MOORS AND MARGINAL FARMLAND SCARRED BY THE REMAINS OF THE MINING INDUSTRY AND CONTAINING NUMEROUS OLD MINING SETTLEMENTS SUFFERING ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL DECLINE. THE GENERAL AIM OF THE PROJECT WAS TO IMPROVE THIS BLEAK ENVIRONMENT BY ENCOURAGING A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMME OF TREE PLANTING.
